meanings.sent1: After waiting for so long, his dream to materialize finally came true.
meanings.sent2: The magic trick made the rabbit materialize out of thin air.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a talking dog may materialize in a cartoon, but not in real life.
meanings.sent4: Her hopes and fears seemed to materialize into physical forms in her dreams.
meanings.sent5: The scientist's theory about time travel materialized into a working prototype.

meanings.sent1: The ship began to materialize on the horizon as it approached the shore.
meanings.sent2: The ghostly figure seemed to materialize out of the mist.
meanings.sent3: The hidden treasure chest materialized when the pirate captain solved the riddle.
meanings.sent4: The memories of her childhood home would materialize in her mind whenever she closed her eyes.
meanings.sent5: The stars started to materialize in the night sky as the sun set.

meanings.definition: To bring into existence or make happen
meanings.sent1: The architect's vision for the new building began to materialize as construction started.
meanings.sent2: The community worked together to materialize their plan for a neighborhood garden.
meanings.sent3: The chef's culinary masterpiece would materialize in the kitchen every evening.
meanings.sent4: With determination and hard work, her dream of starting a business materialized into reality.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush strokes would materialize into beautiful paintings on the canvas.
